creator: roku@apache.org
text:
Currently, if u look at the AC info screens for exapmle, role names are verbs.
IMHO role names should be nouns like "Visitor" and "Reviewer" and not like
"visit" and "review".

Also the names of our workflow states are mixed nouns and adjectives i.e. "live"
is an adjective and "authoring" is ...dunno.
I propose the following adjectives to be used as workflowstates:
- edited (transition via submit)
- submitted (transition via review)
- live[or reviewed]

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Roles are verbs to avoid confusion with groups.

Anyway, I don't think this is a bug because it's entirely up to the integrator
to choose names for workflow states and roles. Maybe we should discuss the
naming in the default publication on lenya-dev.
